roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • roboRallyPackage.Terminatable
      • roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Element
        • roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Robot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEnergyHolder

    public class Robot
extends Element
implements IEnergyHolder
    A class representing robots.
    Version:
    24 may 2012
    Author:
    Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven

      Initialize this new robot with given position, board, orientation, currentEnergy [Ws] and maxEngery [Ws].

      • Robot

        public Robot(Position position,
     Board board,
     Orientation orientation,
     double currentEnergy,
     double maxEnergy)
        Initialize this new robot with given position, board, orientation, currentEnergy [Ws] and maxEngery [Ws].
        Parameters:
        position - The position for this new robot.
        board - The board on which this new robot is placed.
        orientation - The orientation for this new robot.
        currentEnergy - The current energy level for this new robot, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
        maxEnergy - The maximum amount of energy this new robot can ever have, expressed in watt-second [Ws].

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminates this robot. All its possessions are also terminated and removed from the robots list.
        Overrides:
        terminate in class Element

      • getOrientation

        Returns the orientation of this robot.

      • canHaveAsOrientation

        public static final boolean canHaveAsOrientation(Orientation orientation)
        Checks whether the given orientation is a valid orientation for this robot.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given orientation is one of the four following objects from the enumeration Orientation: UP, RIGHT, DOWN or LEFT. | result == (orientation == Orientation.UP | || orientation == Orientation.RIGHT | || orientation == Orientation.DOWN | || orientation == Orientation.LEFT)

      • canHaveAsEnergy

        public boolean canHaveAsEnergy(double energy)
        Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this robot.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        energy - The amount of energy to be checked, expressed in Watt-second.
        Returns:
        False if the given energy is greater than or equal to the maximal amount of energy an IEnergyHolder can have. | result != (energy > this.getMaxEnergy())

        Throws:

      • canHaveAsMaxEnergy

        public boolean canHaveAsMaxEnergy(double maxEnergy)
        Check whether the given maximum energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy for this robot.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsMaxEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        maxEnergy - The maximum energy level to be checked.
        Returns:
        False if the given maximum energy is less than the most expensive cost for an action (otherwise this robot will never be able to do that action) | result != (maxEnergy < java.util.Collections.max(getListCosts()))

      • getEnergyFraction

        public double getEnergyFraction()
        Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this robot can have.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyFraction in interface IEnergyHolder
        Returns:
        A percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this robot can have. | result == (this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) / this.getMaxEnergy()) * 100

        public boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)

        Specified by:
        canAcceptForRecharge in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to be checked, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Returns:
        False if this IEnergyHolder cannot have a total energy level equal to the given amount of energy added to its current energy level. | result == (this.canHaveAsEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + amount))

      • getEnergyRequiredToReach

        public double getEnergyRequiredToReach(Position position)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                       IllegalBoardException
        Returns the minimum amount of energy, expressed in watt-second [Ws], this robot needs to move to the given position. Returns -1 if this robot cannot reach the given position. This would mean that either the robot has insufficient energy to reach the given position or the position is not reachable because of obstacles.
        Parameters:
        position - The position where to this robot may be moved to.
        Returns:
        The minimum amount of energy this robot needs to move to the given position. | energyForPositionWithDifferingOrientation | == {DijkstraSP(this.getBoard().createDiGraphForRobot(this), 0).distTo(thisVertices.indexOf(new OrientatedPosition(position, orientation))) | for all orientation in orientation.values()} | result | == {there exists an energy in energyForPositionWithDifferingOrientation | energy <= otherEnergy | for all otherEnergy in energyForPositionWithDifferingOrientation}
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this robot is terminated | this.isTerminated()
        IllegalBoardException - When this robot is not placed on a board. | this.getBoard() == null

      • getCostToTurn

        public static final double getCostToTurn()
        Returns the energy cost of turning 90 degree, expressed in Watt-second [Ws].

      • getCostToShoot

        public static final double getCostToShoot()
        Returns the energy cost of shooting, expressed in Watt-second [Ws].

      • getCostToMove

        public static final double getCostToMove()
        Returns the energy cost of moving one step, expressed in Watt-second [Ws]. This method does not take into account whether a robot is carrying items or not.

      • getAdditionalCostToMove

        public static final double getAdditionalCostToMove()
        Returns the the additional loss of energy for each kilogram of items this robot is carrying when moving one step, expressed in Watt-second [Ws].

      • getTotalCostToMove

        public double getTotalCostToMove()
        Returns the total energy cost of moving this robot one step, expressed in Watt-second [Ws]. This method takes into account the normal cost and the additional cost per kilogram of items this robot is carrying.
        Returns:
        The cost to move increased with the additional cost to move times the total weight of all the possessions this robot is carrying. | result == Robot.getCostToMove() + Math.round(Robot.getAdditionalCostToMove() * (this.getTotalWeightPossessions()/1000))

      • getPossessions

        public java.util.List<Item> getPossessions()
        Returns a list of all the possessions this robot is carrying.

      • getTotalWeightPossessions

        public int getTotalWeightPossessions()
        Returns the total weight of all the elements this robot is carrying, expressed in grams [g].
        Returns:
        The total weight of all the items this robot is carrying, expressed in kilograms [g]. | for each item in this.getPossessions(): result == result + item.getWeight()

      • getIthHeaviestPossession

        public Item getIthHeaviestPossession(int index)
                              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the iths heaviest possession of this robot.
        Parameters:
        index - The index that indicates the ith heaviest possession.
        Returns:
        The ith heaviest possession | result == this.getPossessions().get(index - 1)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - When the given index is not a valid index | index <= 1 || index > this.getPossessions().size()

      • getPossessionsString

        public java.lang.String getPossessionsString()
        Returns a string representation of all the items this robot is carrying.
        Returns:
        "/" if this robot has no possessions. | if(this.getPossessions() == null) then result == "/"

      • canCarry

        public boolean canCarry(Item item)
        Checks whether this robot carry the given item.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be checked.
        Returns:
        False if the given item is null. | result != (item == null)

      • pickUp

        public void pickUp(Item item)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Picks up the given item. The item is added to the list of possessions of this robot. The item is inserted in the list of possessions based on its weight. The list of possessions of a robot is sorted on the weight of the possessions, starting with the heaviest item (index 0). The board and position of the given item are set to null.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be picked up.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this robot is terminated | this.isTerminated() || item.isTerminated()

      • canPickUp

        public boolean canPickUp(Item item)
        Checks whether this robot can pick up the given item.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be checked.
        Returns:
        False if the item cannot be added to the list of items. | result == this.canCarry(item)

      • getMaxWeightToCarry

        public static final int getMaxWeightToCarry()
        Returns the maximum weight a robot can carry.

      • drop

        public void drop(Item item)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Drops the given item. The item is removed from the list of possessions of this robot. The position of the given item is set to the position of this robot. The board on which the given item is placed is the board on which this robot is placed.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be dropped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this robot is terminated | this.isTerminated()

      • canDrop

        public boolean canDrop(Item item)
        Checks whether this robot can drop the given item.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be dropped.
        Returns:
        False if the given item is null. | result != (item == null)

      • transferItems

        public void transferItems(Robot other)
                   throws IllegalPositionException,
                          IllegalBoardException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Transfers all the items of this robot to the given other robot if possible. If not all items can be transferred, as much items as possible are transferred.
        Parameters:
        other - The other robot that will be given the items.
        Throws:
        IllegalPositionException - When both robots are not placed next to each other | !this.getPosition().getAllNeighbours().contains(other.getPosition())
        IllegalBoardException - When both robots are not placed on the same board. | this.getBoard() != other.getBoard()
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When either this robot or the given robot is terminated | this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()

      • turnClockwise

        public void turnClockwise()
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Turns this robot 90 degrees in clockwise direction if the robot has sufficient energy. Does not modify the state of the robot if it has insufficient energy.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this robot is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • turnCounterClockwise

        public void turnCounterClockwise()
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Turns this robot 90 degrees in counter-clockwise direction if the robot has sufficient energy. Does not modify the state of the robot if it has insufficient energy.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this robot is terminated | this.isTerminated

      • canTurn

        public boolean canTurn(Direction direction)
        Checks whether this robot is able to turn.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction in which this robot may have to turn
        Returns:
        False if this robot does not have enough energy to turn | result == !(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) >= Robot.getCostToTurn())

      • moveOneStep

        public void moveOneStep()
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Moves this robot one step in its current direction if the robot has sufficient energy. Does not modify the state of the robot if it has insufficient energy or if it has been terminated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this robot is terminated | this.isTerminated()

      • canMoveOneStep

        public boolean canMoveOneStep()
        Checks whether this robot can move one step.
        Returns:
        False if the robot is not placed on a board | result == this.getBoard() == null

      • moveNextTo

        public void moveNextTo(Robot other)
                throws IllegalBoardException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Moves this robot and the given robot as close as possible to each other consuming as little energy as possible and taking in account the current energy they have. No inefficient moves or turns are included.
        Parameters:
        other - The other robot where to this robot has to end up as close as possible (both can move!)
        Throws:
        IllegalBoardException - When this robot and the given other robot are not placed on the same board or they are not standing on any board. | other.getBoard() != this.getBoard() || this.getBoard() == null || other.getBoard() == null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this robot or the other robot are terminated | this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()

      • canSharePositionWith

        public boolean canSharePositionWith(Element other)
        Checks whether this robot can share a position with another element.
        Specified by:
        canSharePositionWith in class Element
        Parameters:
        other - The element where to this element may be in conflict.
        Returns:
        False if both this element is a robot and the other element is a robot. | if((this instanceof Robot) && (other instanceof Robot)) then result == false

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Lets this robot shoot its laserbeam to destroy another element. One of the elements that is standing on the first position one encounters when 'walking' in a straight line from the position of the robot with its orientation, is terminated and removed from the board. If no element is standing within the shooting range of this robot, it will shoot anyway, though nothing is hit.
        Throws:
        IllegatStateException - When this is terminated | this.isTerminated()
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • canShoot

        public boolean canShoot()
        Checks whether this robot can use its laser.
        Returns:
        False if this robot is not standing on a board. | result != (this.getBoard() == null)

      • takeHit

        public void takeHit()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        When an element is hit (e.g. it is shot by a robot) some of its properties are altered. This robots maximum energy level is decreased with 4000 Ws if possible, otherwise it is terminated.
        Specified by:
        takeHit in class Element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this robot is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • getProgram

        Returns the program of this robot.

        Parameters:

      • setProgram

        public void setProgram(java.lang.String inputProgram)
                throws IllegalSyntaxException
        Sets the program of this robot, given a string input.
        Parameters:
        inputProgram - A string representation of a program. The program to be set.
        Throws:
        IllgalSyntaxException - When the given string is not a valid string representation of a program | !Parser.isValidStringProgram()
        IllegalSyntaxException

      • runProgramStep

        public void runProgramStep(int n)
        Runs n steps of this robots program. One step of the program means that it will run the program until a basic command (e.g. 'move')
        Parameters:
        n - The number of steps to be executed

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this robot.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Element
        Returns:
        A string of this robot. | result == "Robot with:" + "\n" | + super.toString() + "\n" | + " Energy level: " + this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + "(" + this.getEnergyFraction() + "%)" + "; " + "\n" + " Possessions: " + this.getPossessionsString();
